g.text: All of the results presented here are obtained from ab initio
density functional calculations using the Vienna Ab initio
optimized the crystal structure by minimizing the force and
stress acting on the system. The generalized gradient
is employed to treat the exchange-
correlation as it gives better equilibrium structural parameters
than the local density approximation. The ionic positions and
the shape of the crystals were relaxed for diﬀerent unit cell
volumes until the energy and force convergence criteria were
eV per cell and 1 meV/Å per atom,
respectively. As the structural parameters are very sensitive to
electrical polarization, a very high plane-wave cutoﬀ energy of
mesh was used for ferroelectric PTO, and similar density of
points was used for all other calculations. To ﬁnd the ground-
state magnetic ordering, we have considered nonmagnetic
To account for the strong electron correlation
associated with V 3d electrons on the electronic structure, the
eﬀective charges (BECs) were calculated by the Berry phase
supercell approach to simulate the substituted systems, i.e., for
2 supercells were created, respectively. Then, one Ti
atom was replaced with V to mimic the experimental
conditions. The supercells are again doubled in each direction
to incorporate diﬀerent magnetic orderings. Similar kind of
methodology was used to model other compositions.
The orbital moments at the transition-metal sites were
calculated using the orbital polarization correction (SO + OP)
spectra using Wien2k and estimated the site-selective spin
and orbital magnetic moments of V ions using the XMCD sum
For simulating XMCD, we have used full-potential
on density functional theory as implemented in the Wien2k
code. The generalized gradient approximation within the PBE
scheme was used as the exchange-correlation potential. The
muﬃn tin radii for Pb, V, and O were chosen as 1.66, 2.49, and
1.50 a.u., respectively. The Brillouin zone integration has been
carried out with 5000k-points. The energy convergence with a
coupling is considered in the calculation. As the ferromagnetic
state is a metal, the plasma frequency was ﬁrst calculated and
) due to the presence of a
= 1/2. In oxides, it can either occur in the middle of an
or it can form a strong
vanadyl bond with one O with a short bond length (ca. 1.55
PVO is reported to exhibit a tetragonal-to-cubic
phase transition under pressure, but no structural transition
was observed from 0 K to its decomposition temperature.
pyramid in tetragonal PVO is 1.68 Å. This relatively
longer bond shows a comparatively weaker vanadyl bond than
usual. The average of the four planar V
Å. In agreement with these ﬁndings, the calculated Gold-
schmidt tolerance factor for PVO also shows a value of 1.036,
Here, we have made structural optimizations for both the
compositions. The substitution of V for Ti in PTO does not
aﬀect the symmetry of the crystal as it retains the tetragonal
symmetry for the whole composition range.
an unusual enhancement in the tetragonality of the
. This can be understood on the basis of ionic
ions. The coordination number of Ti
changes from six to ﬁve with increasing concentration of
vanadium. The ionic radius of V
are 0.61 and 0.51 Å for sixfold and ﬁvefold
So, with decrease in ionic radii,
smaller cation. On the other hand, with increase of V
concentration, the chance of vanadyl bond formation increases,
which leads to an increase in the length of
the reason behind the increase in volume with the increase of
. It may be noted that PTO-modiﬁed ferroelectrics such as
usually do not show high value of
ratio. But some of the PTO-based compounds, i.e., (1
show abnormally high tetragonality. In the
present study, the achieved maximum tetragonality (
is larger than that of some of the conventional perovskite
C-type antiferromagnetic structure of PVO. Pb and V atoms
are labeled on the illustration as green (big) and blue (medium)
spheres, respectively. Oxygen atoms occur at the corners of the VO
square pyramid and are labeled as red (small) spheres. Two types of
oxygen atoms are present in PbVO
, one at apical (labeled as O1) and
the other at the planar (labeled as O2) position. The optimized
